articles.title: US to send ICE agents to Winter Olympics, prompting Italian anger
articles.snippet: The US federal agency says it will not play an immigration role at February's event in Milan-Cortina.

articles.title: 'We all know someone who was killed' -  Iran protesters tell BBC of brutal crackdown
articles.snippet: Young Iranians able tell the BBC how they saw friends and other people die as security forces crushed protests earlier this month.

articles.title: Spain plans to give half a million undocumented migrants legal status
articles.snippet: The process will be available to foreign nationals without a criminal record who can prove they lived in Spain for five months prior to 31 December 2025.

articles.title: 'Crying horse' toys go viral in China ahead of Lunar New Year
articles.snippet: Shop owners say the frowning toys - originally made in error - are resonating with young workers.

articles.title: US updates: Border czar arrives to Minnesota, meets Walz
articles.snippet: Tom Homan, Donald Trump's border czar, has arrived to Minnesota to take charge of Operation Metro Surge and relieve Border Patrol commander Gregory Bovino after fatal shootings. Follow the latest updates.

articles.title: Nipah virus: India says only 2 cases confirmed as fears rise
articles.snippet: India's government said there were two confirmed cases of Nipah virus since December last year, with all those in contact with the affected people having been quarantined and tested.

articles.title: ICE agents spark controversy in Italy over Olympics plans
articles.snippet: A group of American ICE agents is set to travel to Italy and provide additional security to the US delegation during the Winter Olympics. "It's not like the SS are coming," Italy's Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani said.

articles.title: Dutch court sentences Eritrean migrant smuggler to 20 years
articles.snippet: A Dutch court on Tuesday sentenced Eritrean Amanuel W. to 20 years in prison in the Netherlands' largest migrant smuggling case so far. More suspects are set to appear in court later this year.

articles.title: Hundreds feared dead in attempt to cross Mediterranean during cyclone
articles.snippet:
Fifty killed in one incident as Italian authorities estimate 380 people may have drowned last week
Up to 380 people may have drowned attempting to cross the Mediterranean last week as Cyclone Harry battered southern Italy and Malta, the Italian coastguard has said, as a shipwreck with the loss of 50 lives was confirmed by Maltese authorities.
Just one person, who was hospitalised in Malta, survived the shipwreck, which happened on Friday.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: Crocodile warnings as floods devastate southern Africa
articles.snippet:
More than 100 people killed and hundreds of thousands displaced in South Africa, Mozambique and Zimbabwe
Devastating floods have killed more than 100 people in southern Africa since the beginning of the year and displaced hundreds of thousands, as authorities and aid workers warn of hunger, cholera and attacks by crocodiles that have spread with the waters.
More than 70 people have died in Zimbabwe and 30 in South Africa, where hundreds of people were evacuated from Kruger national park earlier this month after a deluge of rain.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: ‘It’s the sovereignty of the country’: Guinea-Bissau says US vaccine study suspended
articles.snippet:
Despite US pushback, officials in west Africa say controversial hepatitis B study on pause amid ethics concerns
US health officials insisted it was still on. African health leaders said it was cancelled. At the heart of the controversy is the west African nation of Guinea-Bissau – one of the poorest countries in the world and the proposed site of a hotly debated US-funded study on vaccines.
The study on hepatitis B vaccination, to be led by Danish researchers, became a flashpoint after major changes to the US vaccination schedule and prompted questions about how research is conducted ethically in other countries.
 Continue reading...
articles.titleJa: 「国の主権」：ギニアビサウ、米国のワクチン研究を一時停止と発表

articles.title: ActionAid to rethink child sponsorship as part of plan to ‘decolonise’ its work
articles.snippet:
Development charity’s new co-chief executives signal shift from controversial sponsor a child scheme launched in 1972 to long-term grassroots funding
Child sponsorship schemes that allow donors to handpick children to support in poor countries can carry racialised, paternalistic undertones and need to be transformed, the newly appointed co-chief executives of ActionAid UK said as they set out to “decolonise” the organisation’s work.
ActionAid began in 1972 by finding sponsors for schoolchildren in India and Kenya, but Taahra Ghazi and Hannah Bond have launched their co-leadership this month with the goal of shifting narratives around aid from sympathy towards solidarity and partnership with global movements.
 Continue reading...
articles.titleJa: ActionAid、活動の「脱植民地化」計画の一環として子供のスポンサーシップを見直しへ

articles.title: Why is Pakistan backing Bangladesh in its T20 World Cup row with India?
articles.snippet: Regional politics at the fore after Bangladesh ousted from the T20 World Cup in India.
articles.titleJa: パキスタンがインドとのT20ワールドカップでの論争でバングラデシュを支持するのはなぜ？

articles.title: Minnesota judge orders ICE chief to appear in court
articles.snippet: Judge orders head of ICE to explain agency's handling of bond hearings for immigrants it has detained.
articles.titleJa: ミネソタ州の裁判官、ICE長官に出廷命令

articles.title: Trump’s JPMorgan Chase lawsuit revives debanking concerns in US
articles.snippet: Workers in 'risky' industries and many religious and ethnic groups have been denied access to financial services.
articles.titleJa: トランプ氏のJPMorgan Chase訴訟、米国でデバンキング懸念を再燃

articles.title: Japan says goodbye to last pandas amid strained ties with China
articles.snippet: Thousands gathered in Tokyo to bid farewell to Japan’s last two pandas as they began their return to China.
articles.titleJa: 日本、中国との関係悪化の中で最後のパンダに別れを告げる

articles.title: Israel says it has retrieved remains of final Gaza hostage
articles.snippet: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called Ran Gvili’s return "an extraordinary achievement".
articles.titleJa: イスラエル、最後のガザ人質の遺体収容を発表

articles.title: New Iran videos show bodies piled in hospital and snipers on roofs
articles.snippet: Footage from a hospital in Tehran shows at least 31 bodies piled inside and seven body bags outside.
articles.titleJa: イランの新たなビデオ、病院に積み上げられた遺体と屋根の狙撃兵が映る

articles.title: Israel court hears appeal over ban on independent media access to Gaza
articles.snippet: The Israeli government has stopped foreign journalists from entering the strip since the start of the war, citing security concerns.
articles.titleJa: イスラエル裁判所、ガザへの独立メディアのアクセス禁止に関する控訴審を開廷

articles.title: 'I didn't hear from my son for seven months': Inside Yemen's UAE-run secret prisons
articles.snippet: The BBC sees sites on former United Arab Emirates bases in Yemen where detainees say they were abused.
articles.titleJa: 「7ヶ月間、息子からの連絡がなかった」：イエメンのUAE運営秘密刑務所内部

articles.title: Ex-Nigeria oil minister stands trial in UK on bribery charges
articles.snippet: Diezani Alison-Madueke took bribes including luxury goods and private jet travel, a prosecutor tells a London court.
articles.titleJa: 元ナイジェリア石油大臣、英国で贈賄容疑で裁判

articles.title: Nigeria president 'in great shape' after falling at Turkey reception
articles.snippet: On a visit to Ankara, Bola Tinubu was filmed stumbling and falling after walking past soldiers and dignitaries.
articles.titleJa: ナイジェリア大統領、トルコのレセプションで転倒後「元気」

articles.title: France invites Chad president in bid to ease troubled relations
articles.snippet: Franco-Chadian military relations have been strained after Chad abruptly ended its defence agreement with France.
articles.titleJa: フランス、関係改善のためチャド大統領を招待

articles.title: South Sudan army threat to 'spare no-one' condemned
articles.snippet: The UN mission says it is gravely concerned by "inflammatory rhetoric calling for violence against civilians".
articles.titleJa: 南スーダン軍の「誰も許さない」という脅威を非難

articles.title: Morocco, AFCON, and the controversies that trailed Africa’s biggest football event
articles.snippet: “This isn’t ‘passion,’ it’s medieval conduct wearing a modern jersey, enabled by CAF.”
articles.titleJa: モロッコ、アフリカネイションズカップ、そしてアフリカ最大のサッカーイベントを追った論争

articles.title: Beyond boubou and wax prints: Africa Fashion Tour changes perceptions of African creativity
articles.snippet: African women’s wardrobes are diverse. Quite mixed, African fashion is sometimes traditional, sometimes Western, and sometimes a combination. It is unclassifiable when using a Western frame of reference.
articles.titleJa: ブーボーやワックスプリントを超えて：アフリカファッションツアーがアフリカの創造性の認識を変える

articles.title: Combating the climate crisis to promote peace in Mali
articles.snippet: Between 1970 and 2020, the country experienced at least 40 major climate shocks, with drought affecting around 400,000 people each year and reducing crop revenues by US$9.5 million annually, according to the World Bank.
articles.titleJa: マリでの平和を促進するための気候変動対策

articles.title: What does ‘partnership’ really mean for Africa and the European Union?
articles.snippet: While the African Union designated 2025 as the Year of Reparations, European engagement throughout the year largely remained confined to acknowledgements rather than commitments.
articles.titleJa: 「パートナーシップ」はアフリカと欧州連合にとって本当に何を意味するのか？

articles.title: Spain slashes speed limit on popular train route after fault found
articles.snippet: The discovery of a crack on the Madrid-Barcelona line follows two recent deadly crashes in the country.
articles.titleJa: スペイン、欠陥が見つかった後、人気の列車ルートの速度制限を削減

articles.title: Captain of suspected Russian shadow tanker in French custody
articles.snippet: French officials seized the tanker, named the Grinch, in the Mediterranean Sea on Thursday.
articles.titleJa: フランス当局、ロシアの疑わしい影のタンカーの船長を拘束

articles.title: Greece biscuit factory fire leaves at least four dead
articles.snippet: A search is continuing for one person still missing after a blaze broke out at a biscuit factory near the city of Trikala.
articles.titleJa: ギリシャのビスケット工場火災で少なくとも4人死亡

articles.title: Peace talks on Russia-Ukraine war end as fighting rages
articles.snippet: No breakthrough is reported at the first three-way talks but reports suggest they will resume next month.
articles.titleJa: ロシア・ウクライナ戦争の和平交渉は戦闘激化で終了

articles.title: Gunmen storm Mexico football pitch and kill at least 11 people
articles.snippet: The incident happened in Salamanca, a city particularly subject to gang-related violence.
articles.titleJa: 武装集団がメキシコのサッカー場を襲撃し、少なくとも11人殺害

articles.title: Sly Dunbar, prolific legend of reggae, dies aged 73
articles.snippet: The drummer and producer played with everyone from Bob Marley to The Rolling Stones and Madonna.
articles.titleJa: レゲエ界の伝説、スライ・ダンバーが73歳で死去

articles.title: Former Olympian Ryan Wedding pleads not guilty to drug kingpin charges
articles.snippet: The ex-Olympic snowboarder and accused cartel leader was taken into custody in Mexico last week by the FBI.
articles.titleJa: 元オリンピック選手ライアン・ウェディングが麻薬王の容疑で無罪を主張

articles.title: Venezuela frees dozens of political prisoners, human rights group says
articles.snippet: It is the latest batch of detainees freed since the US seized Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro in a raid.
articles.titleJa: ベネズエラが数十人の政治犯を釈放、人権団体が発表

articles.title: Venezuela inflates release figures as political prisoners remain in limbo
articles.snippet: As Venezuelan authorities claim a mass release of political prisoners, families wait outside detention centers without answers, or guarantees. Behind the government’s discourse of reconciliation, uncertainty and fear persist.
articles.titleJa: ベネズエラ、政治犯の釈放数を水増し、政治犯は未だ不明のまま

articles.title: The peacemakers: Meet Venezuelans who are fighting to free political detainees
articles.snippet: In Venezuela, relatives and human-rights NGOs have stepped up calls for the immediate release of more than 800 victims of politically-motivated persecution of the government formerly led by Nicolás Maduro.
articles.titleJa: 平和構築者たち：政治犯解放のために戦うベネズエラの人々

articles.title: Venezuela after Maduro: Leadership of the South American nation seems uncertain
articles.snippet: Since the airstrikes, there has been a huge sense of uncertainty, with long queues in local supermarkets and gas stations, and Caracas residents worried about basic necessities like groceries.
articles.titleJa: マドゥロ後のベネズエラ：南米の指導部は不確実に見える

articles.title: A new, terrifying sound: A Venezuelan account of the the attack on Caracas
articles.snippet: “I thought Venezuelans had already heard every sound the country’s violence had to offer. But this was something new — terrifying in its unfamiliarity.”
articles.titleJa: 新しい、恐ろしい音：カラカス攻撃に関するベネズエラの報告

articles.title: Trump's shadow looms over India-EU trade deal
articles.snippet: Despite strong relations between India and EU, trade talks were stuck for two decades. So what changed now?
articles.titleJa: トランプ氏の影がインドEU貿易協定に迫る

articles.title: Tearful goodbyes as Japan returns pandas to China amid worsening ties
articles.snippet: The twin cubs' departure will leave Japan without any pandas for the first time since 1972.
articles.titleJa: 関係悪化の中、日本がパンダを中国に返還し涙の別れ

articles.title: Japanese ex-soldier reaches settlements in landmark sex abuse case
articles.snippet: Rina Gonoi, a former soldier, was sexually assaulted while serving in Japan's Self-Defense Forces.
articles.titleJa: 日本の元兵士、画期的な性的虐待事件で和解成立

articles.title: Tributes pour in across India for revered BBC broadcaster Sir Mark Tully
articles.snippet: Sir Mark Tully's cremation was held on Monday in Delhi, where he lived even after leaving the BBC.
articles.titleJa: インド全土で尊敬されるBBC放送士、マーク・タリー卿への追悼の声

articles.title: India and EU announce 'mother of all trade deals'
articles.snippet: The long-awaited deal comes as both Delhi and Brussels contend with economic and geopolitical pressure from the US.

articles.title: Firefighters battle 'emergency level' blazes in Australia heatwave
articles.snippet: Firefighters in Victoria are battling at least six major fires amid a record-breaking heatwave.

articles.title: Canadian PM Carney denies walking back Davos speech in phone call with Trump
articles.snippet: The Canadian prime minister confirmed that he and the US president spoke by phone after Trump threatened 100% tariffs on Canada.

articles.title: Sweden aims to lower age of criminal responsibility to 13 as gangs recruit children
articles.snippet: Critics say the proposal could see even younger children becoming offenders as well as breaching children's rights.

articles.title: TikTok US pushes back on claims it is censoring content
articles.snippet: Thousands of people claim political content is being suppressed after the US operation was spun off.

articles.title: Rwanda takes legal action against UK over axed migrant deal
articles.snippet: The African nation argues it is owed payments but Downing Street says it will fight the case.

articles.title: One Battle After Another leads Bafta nominations
articles.snippet: The political thriller has 14 nominations, with Sinners, Hamnet and Marty Supreme also recognised.

articles.title: Trump raises US tariffs on South Korea imports to 25%
articles.snippet: Trump has accused Seoul of "not living up" to a trade deal that was reached last year.

articles.title: Philippines' Duterte fit to face ICC proceedings, judges say
articles.snippet: The 80-year-old is accused of crimes of humanity over his bloody war on drugs that left thousands killed.

articles.title: Deadly US winter storm leaves flights delayed and thousands without power
articles.snippet: At least a dozen people have died in multiple US states possibly due to the storm, officials have said.

articles.title: Japan court orders compensation for migrants lured to North Korea
articles.snippet: The plaintiffs said North Korea was marketed to them as "paradise on Earth".

articles.title: Nipah virus outbreak in India triggers Asia airport screenings
articles.snippet: Airports in Thailand and Nepal have begun screening passengers from West Bengal.

articles.title: 'Major step': French MPs vote in favour of bill to ban social media for under-15s
articles.snippet: If the bill passes the upper house it could take effect by the start of France's new school year in September.

articles.title: Instagram, Facebook and WhatsApp to trial premium subscriptions
articles.snippet: Under the plan, access to the Meta platforms' core services would remain free.

articles.title: China has purged its highest-ranked military general. Why?
articles.snippet: Zhang Youxia had been seen as a close ally of China's leader, Xi Jinping.

articles.title: Trump abandons attack mode as Minneapolis shooting backlash grows
articles.snippet: The White House has shifted how it talks about Alex Pretti's killing as more Republicans express concern over the deadly encounter.

articles.title: How does Germany deport people?
articles.snippet: Germany does not have masked ICE officers or an equivalent agency, but both Chancellor Friedrich Merz and his predecessor have done all they can to accelerate deportations. Here's how the process works.

articles.title: Spain to grant legal status to 500,000 undocumented migrants
articles.snippet: Spain is moving against the European tide with a plan to offer a chance at residency status to hundreds of thousands of undocumented migrants. The move has exposed a deep political divide for the minority government.

articles.title: FIFA ex-President Blatter backs call to boycott World Cup
articles.snippet: With the US due to co-host the football World Cup this summer, former FIFA President Sepp Blatter said a former colleague was "right" to advise supporters to "stay home" and watch on TV amid an immigration crackdown.

articles.title: China: Is Xi Jinping losing trust in his top generals?
articles.snippet: A corruption scandal in the People's Liberation Army has rocked China's military. Probes into two of President Xi Jinping's deputies highlight a struggle over loyalty, power and control within the armed forces.

articles.title: Germany's Green Party under pressure over Mercosur vote
articles.snippet: The Greens are big supporters of international agreements. But now, eight German lawmakers in the European Parliament have all but scuppered the Mercosur free trade agreement — defying their party leadership.

articles.title: South Korea's 'fake news' law tests press autonomy
articles.snippet: Critics accuse lawmakers of pushing measures that could stifle a free press, while Seoul says the changes are needed to manage the rapidly evolving media landscape.

articles.title: Protests in Iran: Ali Karimi leads sports' call for support
articles.snippet: Former Iran and Bayern Munich footballer Ali Karimi has signed an open letter, asking FIFA to act. He is not the only athlete to be vocal.

articles.title: Plastic emissions could double health damage by 2040
articles.snippet: Plastic pollution could double its harm to human health in the coming decades if current production trends continue, according to a new study that links rising risks directly to the manufacture of new plastics.

articles.title: Flooding hammers Mozambique, southern African neighbors
articles.snippet: Weeks of heavy rainfall have caused severe floods across southern Africa, with Mozambique and South Africa among the hardest hit. Rising water has destroyed infrastructure, affecting 1.3 million people.

articles.title: IOC rejects extra Winter Olympics spot for skeleton's Uhlaender
articles.snippet: IOC President Kirsty Coventry had been asked to intervene after Katie Uhlaender was the victim of alleged competition manipulation, causing her to miss out on February's Winter Olympics.

articles.title: Germany news: Shadow economy grows to over $500B
articles.snippet: A new study shows the shadow economy in Germany has grown to its highest level in over decade. Meanwhile, Germany has welcomed a new trade agreement between the EU and India. DW has the latest.

articles.title: German FA believe World Cup boycott would be 'misguided'
articles.snippet: At the first DFL meeting of 2026, German FA boss Bernd Neuendorf spoke for the first time about a World Cup boycott.

articles.title: Holocaust Remembrance Day: Europe remembers Nazi genocide
articles.snippet: Auschwitz survivor Tatiana Bucci has addressed MEPs in a special session. An event will be held at the Auschwitz-Birkenau memorial in Poland to commemorate the concentration camp's liberation 81 years ago. DW has more.

articles.title: Holocaust survivor Leon Weintraub: "We were dehumanized"
articles.snippet: The 100-year-old vividly recalls the hunger, death camps and cruelty of the guards. Thus, he tirelessly works to ensure that the Holocaust is never forgotten.

articles.title: Paris Agreement 10 years on: More wins than you may realize
articles.snippet: Major emitter the US has officially left the Paris Agreement and global emissions keep rising a decade on from the deal. Yet renewables' growth shows climate action can work. Here's what's been done and what's missing.

articles.title: 'Trauma still felt': North African Jews and the Holocaust
articles.snippet: The Nazi persecution of Jews in Europe during World War II also had its effects on North African Jews, who experienced death, forced labor, hunger and looting of their property by Nazi Germany and its allies.

articles.title: Head of US Africa bureau urges staff to highlight US ‘generosity’ despite aid cuts
articles.snippet:
Email sent to diplomats by state department office’s new boss is labelled ‘racist’ after dismissing Africa as a priority
US diplomats have been encouraged to “unabashedly and aggressively” remind African governments about the “generosity” of the American people, according to a leaked email sent to staff in the US state department’s Bureau of African Affairs this January and obtained by the Guardian.
“It’s not gauche to remind these countries of the American people’s generosity in containing HIV/Aids or alleviating famine,” says the email.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: Mexico’s president says cancellation of oil shipment to Cuba is ‘sovereign’ decision
articles.snippet:
Claudia Sheinbaum denied move was response to pressure from the US, after Trump said ‘zero’ oil would go to Cuba
Mexico has cancelled a shipment of oil to Cuba, the country’s president, Claudia Sheinbaum, appeared to confirm on Tuesday, but she insisted the decision was “sovereign” and not the response to pressure from the US.
Fuel shortages are causing increasingly severe blackouts in Cuba, and Mexico has been the island’s biggest oil supplier since the US blocked shipments from Venezuela last month.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: Five-year-old deported to Honduras despite being US citizen is latest child victim of Trump crackdown
articles.snippet:
Mother whose visa application was pending says she will send girl back to US soon accompanied by another relative
Five-year-old Génesis Ester Gutiérrez Castellanos misses her cousins, classmates and kindergarten teachers in Austin, Texas. Despite being a US citizen, she was deported on 11 January alongside her mother, Karen Guadalupe Gutiérrez Castellanos, to Honduras, a country Génesis had never known.
Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents were acting on an administrative deportation order against Gutiérrez, 26, issued in 2019, before Génesis was born.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: Canadian ex-Olympian pleads not guilty to 17 felonies including drug trafficking
articles.snippet:
Authorities allege Ryan Wedding, 44, ‘turned to a life of crime’ after his snowboarding career ended
Ryan Wedding, the Canadian former Olympic snowboarder accused of cocaine distribution and orchestrating several murders, appeared on Monday in a southern California courtroom for arraignment.
The 44-year-old has been charged with drug trafficking, conspiracy to murder, witness tampering and money laundering, among other charges. Authorities allege that after his snowboarding career, Wedding “turned to a life of crime” as a narcotics trafficker and led an organization that moved cocaine from South America to the US and Canada.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: Guyanese businessman facing US extradition elected opposition leader
articles.snippet:
Azruddin Mohamed’s election comes six months after he formed political party that became country’s second largest
A Guyanese businessman facing extradition to the US on gold-smuggling and money-laundering charges has been elected as the country’s opposition leader, six months after he formed a political party that quickly became the second largest in the South American country.
Azruddin Mohamed, 38, was confirmed as Guyana’s opposition leader after 16 lawmakers from the We Invest in Nationhood party (Win) and another from a single-seat outfit voted in his favor. The tally made Win the second-largest party in parliament, securing Mohamed’s election even as a magistrate’s court hears state arguments for his extradition to the US.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: UK supermarkets push for Amazon soy safeguards after traders abandon ban
articles.snippet:
European retailers urge traders to adhere to commitments after Brazilian lawmakers wreck forest protection pact
Leading British and European retailers are trying to salvage the core elements of the Amazon soy moratorium after the world’s most successful forest protection agreement was wrecked by Brazilian lawmakers and abandoned by international traders.
In an open letter, high street brands including Tesco, Sainsbury’s and Asda say the breakdown this month of the 20-year-old agreement will damage consumer confidence unless new arrangements are put in place to ensure grain production is not linked to deforestation.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: ‘I lost part of my heart’: last of Japan’s pandas leave for China as ties fray
articles.snippet:
Hundreds at zoo in Tokyo say farewell to Lei Lei and Xiao Xiao, as China ends ‘panda diplomacy’ with Japan
Hundreds of people have gathered to say farewell to two popular pandas departing Tokyo for China, leaving Japan without any of the beloved bears for the first time in 50 years, as ties between the Asian neighbours fray.
Panda twins Lei Lei and Xiao Xiao were transported by truck out of Ueno zoological gardens, their birthplace, disappointing many Japanese fans who have grown attached to the furry four-year-olds.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: Trump says he will impose new tariffs on South Korea as he criticises delays in trade deal
articles.snippet:
US president says tariffs on automobiles, lumber and pharmaceuticals will rise to 25%, accusing Seoul of not living up to a trade deal struck last year
Donald Trump has said he is raising tariffs on South Korean goods including automobiles, lumber and pharmaceuticals, accusing the country of not living up to a trade deal struck last year and briefly sending shares in Korean carmakers tumbling.
In a post on social media, the US president said the tariffs paid on South Korean exports into America would rise from 15% to 25% because the “Korean Legislature hasn’t enacted our Historic Trade Agreement, which is their prerogative”.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: Fate of China’s top general more likely to do with power struggle than corruption
articles.snippet:
Experts suggest Xi Jinping is asserting his authority by sidelining an officer who has significantly betrayed his trust
Standing inches from Xi Jinping at a military ceremony in late December, China’s highest-ranking general, Zhang Youxia, may have had little inkling about the fate that was to befall him just a few weeks later when he was put under investigation.
The 75-year-old’s physical proximity to China’s leader, who stands to his right, reflects the position he holds in China’s hierarchy. As vice-chair of the Central Military Commission (CMC), the ruling body of the People’s Liberation Army (PLA), he is the second-most powerful person in China’s military, after Xi, the commander-in-chief.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: At least 18 people dead as Philippines ferry with 350 onboard sinks
articles.snippet:
Rescuers save at least 316 after inter-island ferry sank en route from city of Zamboanga to southern Jolo island
A ferry with more than 350 people onboard sank early on Monday near an island in the southern Philippines, killing at least 18 people, officials said. Rescuers saved hundreds more, while a fleet of coastguard and naval ships searched for those still missing.
Coastguard officials said the cargo and passenger ferry apparently encountered technical problems and sank after midnight. The steel-hulled vessel abruptly tilted to one side and took on water, hurling people into the sea in the darkness, according to a rescued passenger who lost his six-month-old baby.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: China’s top general under investigation for alleged violations amid corruption crackdown
articles.snippet:
Zhang Youxia, long seen as Xi Jinping’s closest military ally, reportedly accused of leaking nuclear secrets to US
China’s military leadership is in turmoil after its most senior general – a close ally of Xi Jinping – was placed under investigation for “suspected serious violations of discipline and law”.
Zhang Youxia is the joint vice-chairperson of the Central Military Commission (CMC), the ruling body of China’s People’s Liberation Army (PLA). Second only to Xi in the military command structure, Zhang has long been seen as the Chinese president’s closest military ally.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: Sussan Ley has two factors working in her favour as rumours of a Liberal leadership mutiny swirl
articles.snippet:
As Andrew Hastie and Angus Taylor emerge as likely challengers, two things could buy Ley some time

Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

In the chaotic few hours after the Nationals leader, David Littleproud, blew up the Coalition, one thing appeared clear to many Liberal MPs.
Sussan Ley’s leadership of the Liberal party was all but over.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: Guardian Essential poll: One Nation’s primary vote soars to record high amid Coalition chaos
articles.snippet:
Pauline Hanson’s party polls a primary vote of 22%, while Labor’s response to the Bondi terror attack wins widespread support

Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

One Nation’s polling surge has continued with a record-high primary vote of 22% in the latest Guardian Essential poll off the back of ongoing Coalition chaos and rising social tensions.
Meanwhile, there is widespread public support for the Labor government’s response to the Bondi beach terror attack, with a majority backing crackdowns on guns, hate speech and protests. However, most poll respondents say Anthony Albanese has poorly handled the fallout from the antisemitic shooting.
 Continue reading...

articles.title: Through the heatwave haze, the hypocrisy of Australia’s fossil fuel policy shines bright | Clean Air
articles.snippet:
The heatwave in Melbourne and Adelaide this week is likely to become the norm. We should prepare now

Want to get this in your inbox when it publishes? Sign up for the Clear Air Australia newsletter here

On Tuesday, Australia’s second largest city baked through one of its hottest days since modern instrumental records began in 1910. Several Melbourne suburbs topped 45C.
The country’s fifth largest city, Adelaide, reached that temperature on Monday. Its residents then suffered through their hottest night ever, with a minimum of about 34C.
Sign up to get climate and environment editor Adam Morton’s Clear Air column as a free newsletter
 Continue reading...

articles.title: Heat records tumble in Victoria as authorities warn against complacency amid significant blazes
articles.snippet:
BoM to check if Walpeup and Hopetoun broke state’s official heat record - set during 2009’s Black Saturday

What happens to the human body in 49C heat? Australians are finding out

Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

Victoria may have sweltered through its hottest temperatures on record, with preliminary readings of 48.9C at two locations in the state’s north-west both higher than that recorded during 2009’s Black Saturday.
According to initial data recorded by the Bureau of Meteorology, the Mallee towns of Hopetoun and Walpeup reached 48.9C on Tuesday afternoon. This would exceed the previous highest temperature of 48.8C, recorded at Hopetoun on 7 February 2009.
 Continue reading...

Victoria to open nation’s first offshore wind auction this year
Australia’s first offshore wind auction is set to kick off this year, with the Victorian Government announcing it would invite tenders for 2 gigawatts of capacity in August.
We want to give industry the certainty it needs to invest and help us keep building the renewable energy Victoria needs to push down energy bills.
